fields.headline: Peter Schmeichel factfile
fields.bodyText: 1963: Born Gladsaxe, Denmark November 18. 1984: Makes debut for Hvidovre IF in Denmark. 1987: After 88 League appearances and, remarkably, six goals, signs for Brondby. 1991: Joins Manchester United for £600,000. 1992: April Wins first medal in Rumbelows Cup victory over Nottingham Forest. May Loses out on Championship medal as United falter to hand title to Leeds. June Wins European Championship winners' medal with Denmark after victory over Germany in Sweden. 1993: Helps United to first League title in 26 years. 1994: March Sent off in FA Cup quarter-final against Charlton. May Helps United clinch League and FA Cup Double, but misses run-in to the title with an ankle ligament injury. First back trouble flares in League game at Crystal Palace. 1995: FebruaryThreatens to boycott Euro 96 unless organisers can guarantee his safety. September Scores against Rotor Volgograd in UEFA Cup first round but United are still knocked out. 1996: May Wins second Double with United. June Competes for Denmark in Euro 96. October Beaten 11 times in two games - five against Newcastle and six at Southampton - prompting speculation he is finished. November denies making racist remarks against Arsenal striker Ian Wright. 1997: February Wright makes two-footed challenge on Schmeichel in what is seen as a revenge attack. April Misses first leg of Champions' League semi-final against Borussia Dortmund through back injury after claiming current United side would beat 1968 European Cup winners 10-0. Later apologises to Sir Bobby Charlton for remark. May Wins fourth League title. September Becomes the first goalkeeper to keep 100 Premiership clean sheets. 1998: March Misses Champions' League quarter-final against Monaco after sustaining hamstring injury while chasing upfield for equaliser in League game v Arsenal at Old Trafford. June Plays in all five World Cup games for Denmark and makes 100th international appearance v Saudi Arabia. August Voted best goalkeeper in European competition by 24 coaches of quarter-finalists in UEFA competitions in 1997-98 season. September Error against Bayern Munich in Champions' League robs United of all three points against German champions. November 12 Announces he is to retire from English football at the end of the season. 1999: May Wins League and FA Cup double for a third time and captained the side in his last appearance for United in Champions' Cup final against Bayern Munich - which brought a 2-1 victory and completed an historic treble. June Signed two-year deal with Sporting Lisbon worth around £580,000 a year. August Voted Danish player of the year. October Reveals he was nearly sacked by Alex Ferguson after dressing room row during 3-3 draw with Liverpool in 1994. December Buys Danish Second Division side Hvidovre Fodbold. 2000: March Reveals he wants to play in 2002 World Cup finals in Japan and South Korea. May At fault for both goals as league champions Sporting Lisbon lose Portuguese Cup final replay to Porto. 2001: February Announces retirement from international action after 14 years and 128 caps. April Reveals he wants to return to manage Manchester United one day. May Announces he is leaving Sporting Lisbon. July 12 Signs one-year deal with Aston Villa. October 20 After helping Villa to an unbeaten start to the Premiership campaign with some vintage displays, scores a goal in the final minute of the 3-2 defeat at Everton after going up for a corner. December 10 Awarded honorary MBE for services to football.
